member.summary: SVG 1.1 lacks ability to define insets for markers. Aspose.Slides SVG writing engine has workaround for that problem: it crops end of line with arrow, so, line doesn't overlap markers. This option switches off such behaviour.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Pptx.TabEx.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.
member.returns:
A 32-bit integer that indicates the relative order of the comparands. The return value has these meanings:
< 0 - This instance is less than obj.
= 0 - This instance is equal to obj.
> 0 - This instance is greater than obj.

member.summary: Returns the cell of a table.
member.param: column
row
member.returns: Cell object or null if cell not found.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Table.GetRowHeight(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the height of the specified row in a table. Note: returned value can differ from value, set by SetRowHeight method.
member.param: Row index.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Table.SetRowHeight(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets new height for the specified row in a table. Note: real height of a row can differ from this value if text doesn't fit. Guaranteed that row's height won't be less than the specified value. To obtain value, previously set by this method, use GetMinimalRowHeight method.
member.param: Row index.
New row minimal height.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Table.GetMinimalRowHeight(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns user set row height. Actual row height will be always greater or equal to this value and can differ if text doesn't fit to a cell.
member.param: Row index.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Table.SetColumnWidth(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets new width for the specified column in a table.
member.param: Column index.
New column width.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.GraphicPathFigureFactory
member.summary: A factory that produces APS paths representing different geometrical figures. ///

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.GraphicPathFigureFactory.#ctor
member.summary: No ctor.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.GraphicPathFigureFactory.AddToPath(Aspose.Rendering.ApsPath@,System.Drawing.PointF[],System.Drawing.Drawing2D.PathPointType[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds points to the ApsPath based on GDI+ GraphicsPath
member.remarks: Each point in a GraphicsPath object has a type associated with it. The type determines how the point is used to draw the path. Point types that make up shapes include start points, stop points, and Bezier curve points. Types also include markers, which allow easy traversal of a path or a mask to show or hide points. The Line type and any of the Bezier types can be combined with CloseSubpath (by using the bitwise operator OR) to indicate that the corresponding point is the last point in a figure and that the figure should be closed.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.GraphicPathFigureFactory.AddPathFigure(Aspose.Rendering.ApsPathFigure@,System.Collections.ArrayList,System.Drawing.Drawing2D.PathPointType)
member.summary: Adds a segment to the ApsPathFigure
member.param: Reference to the ApsPathFigure object
ArrayList of the figure segment points
The type of the figure segment to add

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ThreeDFormat.SkewAngle
member.summary: Returns or sets the skew angle. Used when projection is parallel to make visible side faces of the shape. Value 0 means there is no skew, to make angle equal to zero use -360. Note: This property is for advanced control only. Use instead. Read/write

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ThreeDFormat.SkewAmount
member.summary: Returns or sets amount of skew in percents of shape's depth. Used when projection is parallel to make visible side faces of the shape. Note: This property is for advanced control only. Use instead. Read/write

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ThreeDFormat.ViewpointOriginX
member.summary: Determines X component of viewpoint origin. Viewpoint origin X will be equal to Shape.X + ViewpointOriginX * Shape.Width. Viewpoint determines so called "vanishing point" - point to which all lines, parallel to Z axis will converge. Used when projection is perspective to make visible side faces of shape. Note: This property is for advanced control only. Use instead. Read/write

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ThreeDFormat.ViewpointOriginY
member.summary: Determines Y component of viewpoint origin. Viewpoint origin Y will be equal to Shape.Y + ViewpointOriginY * Shape.Height. Viewpoint determines so called "vanishing point" - point to which all lines, parallel to Z axis will converge. Used when projection is perspective to make visible side faces of shape. Note: This property is for advanced control only. Use instead. Read/write

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ThreeDFormat.ViewpointOffsetX
member.summary: Determines X component of viewpoint offset in points (1/72 of inch). Viewpoint determines so called "vanishing point" - point to which all lines, parallel to Z axis will converge. Used when projection is perspective to make visible side faces of shape. Note: This property is for advanced control only. Use instead. Read/write

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ThreeDFormat.ViewpointOffsetY
member.summary: Determines Y component of viewpoint offset in points (1/72 of inch). Viewpoint determines so called "vanishing point" - point to which all lines, parallel to Z axis will converge. Used when projection is perspective to make visible side faces of shape. Note: This property is for advanced control only. Use instead. Read/write

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Connector.Validate
member.summary: Ensures connector's begin and end points lie on connection sites. Aspose.Slides automatically validates connectors before drawing, saving etc. You may need to call this method when moved some shapes and want to get correct connectors size an position. If you want to move connector along with connected shapes without changing connector's shape, simply move all connected shapes to same distance and direction without Validate() call between movements.

member.summary: Returns or sets a depth of a paragraph. Read/write .

member.summary: Determines whether the paragraph has a bullet. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns true if bullet has own color and false if bullet uses color of the first portion in a paragraph. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.BulletColor
member.summary: Returns or sets a color of a bullet. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.BulletColorIndex
member.summary: Returns or sets the index of a bulet's color in a color scheme or -1 for scheme-independed color. Read/write

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.IsBulletHardFont
member.summary: Returns true if bullet has own font and false if bullet uses font of the first portion in the paragraph. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.BulletFontIndex
member.summary: Returns or sets the font of a bullet. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.IsBulletHardSize
member.summary: Returns true if bullet has own size and false if bullet uses size of the first portion in the paragraph. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.BulletHeight
member.summary: Returns or sets the bullet size relative to the size of the first portion in the paragraph. Can be a short value from 25 through 400, indicating that the bullet size can be from 25 percent through 400 percent of the text-character size. Negative value means bullet height is equal to absolute BulletHeight value and does not depend on portion's font height. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.BulletCharacter
member.summary: Returns or sets the character that is used for bullets in the specified text. Switches bullet type to Symbol on assigning. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.SpaceBefore
member.summary: Returns or sets the amount of space before the first line in the paragraph, Positive value means space defined in percents of line. Values -8 and less should be devided by -8 to obtain space in points. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.SpaceAfter
member.summary: Returns or sets the amount of space after the last line in the paragraph, Positive value means space defined in percents of line. Values -8 and less should be devided by -8 to obtain space in points. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.SpaceWithin
member.summary: Returns or sets the amount of space between base lines in the paragraph, Positive value means space defined in percents of line. Values -8 and less should be devided by -8 to obtain space in points. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.BulletOffset
member.summary: Returns or sets the offset of a bullet. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.TextOffset
member.summary: Returns or sets the offset of a text. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.DefaultTabInterval
member.summary: Returns or sets the distance between two closest implicit tabulation positions. Read/write

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.Alignment
member.summary: Returns or sets the alignment of a paragraph. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.ExtendedBullet
member.summary: Returns true if paragraph has extended bullets (image or numbered). Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.BulletType
member.summary: Returns or sets the type of a bullet. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.NumberedBulletStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets the style of a numbered bullet. Value ignored for other types of bullets. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.NumberedBulletStartWith
member.summary: Returns or sets the beginning value of a numbered bullet. On assigning value greater than 0, switches bullet type to numbered. Read/Write

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.PictureBulletId
member.summary: Returns or sets the PictureBullet id. -1 for other types of bullets.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.RawAlignment
member.summary: Returns or sets the alignment of a paragraph. TextAlignment.Default means value should be inherited from the master. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.RawBulletColor
member.summary: Returns or sets the color of a bullet. Color.Empty means value should be inherited from the master. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.RawBulletFontIndex
member.summary: Returns or sets the font of the bullet. -1 means font should be inherited from the master. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.RawBulletHeight
member.summary: Returns or sets the bullet size relative to the size of the first portion in the paragraph. Can be a short value from 25 through 400, indicating that the bullet size can be from 25 percent through 400 percent of the text-character size. -1 means value should be inherited from the master. Another negative value means bullet height is equal to absolute RawBulletHeight value and does not depend on portion's font height. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.RawBulletCharacter
member.summary: Returns or sets the character that is used for bullets in the specified text. Switches bullet type to Symbol on assigning. (char)-1 means value should be inherited from the master. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.RawSpaceBefore
member.summary: Returns or sets the amount of space before the first line in a paragraph, Positive value means space defined in percents of line. Values -8 and lesser should be devided by -8 to obtain space in points. -1 means value should be inherited from the master. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.RawSpaceAfter
member.summary: Returns or sets the amount of space after the last line in a paragraph, Positive value means space defined in percents of line. Values -8 and lesser should be devided by -8 to obtain space in points. -1 means value should be inherited from the master. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.RawSpaceWithin
member.summary: Returns or sets the amount of space between base lines in a paragraph, Positive value means space defined in percents of line. Values -8 and lesser should be devided by -8 to obtain space in points. -1 means value should be inherited from the master. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.RawBulletOffset
member.summary: Returns or sets the offset of a bullet. -1 means value should be inherited from the ruler or the master. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.RawTextOffset
member.summary: Returns or sets the offset of a text. -1 means value should be inherited from the ruler or the master. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.RawDefaultTabInterval
member.summary: Returns or sets distance between two closest implicit tabulation positions. -1 means value should be inherited from the ruler or the master. Read/write

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.RawNumberedBulletStyle
member.summary: Returns or sets the style of a numbered bullet. NumberedBulletStyle.BulletDefault means value should be inherited from the master. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Paragraph.RawNumberedBulletStartWith
member.summary: Returns or sets the beginning value of a numbered bullet. -1 means value should be inherited from the master. Read/Write

member.summary:
Returns or sets the PictureBullet Id. Read/Write

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.
